name: Hypericum
Relationship: Compare: LEDUM (punched wounds and bites of animals); ARNICA; STAPHIS.; CALEN.; RUTA; COFF.Antidotes: ARS.; CHAM.
Modalities: Worse: in a fog; in close room; least exposure; touch

Head: In fractured skull, bone splinters
Facial neuralgia and toothache of a pulling, tearing character, with sadness
Head feels longer - elongated to a point
Brain feels alive
Brain seems compressed
Throbbing in vertex; worse in close room
Pains in eyes and ears
Falling out of hair
Brain-fag and neurasthenia
Heavy; feels as if touched by an icy cold hand
Right side of face aches
Respiratory: Asthma worse foggy weather and relieved by profuse perspiration
Stomach: Tongue coated white at base, tip clean
Rectum: Hemorrhoids, with pain, bleeding, and tenderness
Mind: Feels as if lifted high in air, or anxiety lest he fall from heights
Back: Coccyx injury from fall, with pain radiating up spine and down limbs
Skin: Old ulcers or sores in mouth when very sensitive
Hyperidrosis, sweating of scalp, worse in morning after sleep; falling of hair from injury; eczema of hands and face, intense itching, eruption seems to be under the skin
Lacerated wounds with much prostration from loss of blood
Extremities: Neuritis, with tingling, burning pain, numbness and flossy skin
Pain in toes and fingers, especially in tips
Pressure along ulnar side of arm
Lancinating pain in upper and lower limbs

details: The great remedy for injuries to nerves, especially of fingers, toes and nails. Crushed fingers, especially tips. Excessive painfulness is a guiding symptom to its use. Prevents lockjaw. PUNCTURED wounds. Relieves pain after operations. Quite supersedes the use of Morphia after operations. (Helmuth.) Spasms after every injury. Has an important action on the rectum; hemorrhoids. COCCYDYNIA. Spasmodic asthmatic attacks with changes of weather or before storms, better by copious expectoration. Injured nerves from bites of animals. Tetanus. Neuritis, tingling, burning and numbness. Constant drowsiness.
